page.title: 01GUITING POWER.VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Village Life Our village is a very old one because it is mentioned in the first Domesday Book. Our area consists of two villages, several farms, grazing land and land under cultivation. One road,B 4068, crosses the area. There are the following amenities- 1 school,2 churches,2 Baptist chapels, 2 Sub-Post Offices,1 Baker/Grocer, 1 Garage/Filling Station,2 Village Halls,2 Sports Fields,4 Pubs,1 Guest House,1 Stud Farm and 1 river, the Windrush,a tributary of the Thames. No amusement arcades, discos, cinemas, few jobs that don't involve travelling. BUT--------------------- No petrol fumes, no pollution, space for pets, big gardens and cycling, woods, rivers,quiet nights and friends in place of strangers.
